message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.CL 

This paper deals with the optimization of wireless communication systems using Reconfigurable Intelligent Surfaces (RIS). The paper focuses on the energy efficiency of the system, which is a key concern in the field of Information Theory (cs.IT). The use of RIS also involves the manipulation of signals and the optimization of their propagation, which falls under the category of Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI). The paper also proposes algorithms for optimization, which can be considered as a part of Systems and Control (cs.SY). The use of RIS can also have applications in Multimedia (cs.MM) and Natural Language Processing (cs.CL), but these are less likely categories for this paper.
